travelers.name: Olberic Eisenberg
travelers.bio: Prior to the fall of his country, Olberic was a knight who dedicated his life to the safety of his liege and kingdom. After the fall of his country, he had lost his purpose as a knight and constantly questioned what his reason for living was. Gaston, the boss of the brigands he had encountered in his starting chapter, described how his eyes looked dead and only lit up like flames upon mention of Erhardt. However, even if he has forgotten his reason for fighting, he still dedicates himself to protecting those he cares about till the bitter end. This ends up being the answer Olberic has been seeking for so long. As a knight, Olberic is honorable and has a strong sense of justice, feeling the need to protect those around him. His experiences and his knowledge provide him with much wisdom of the battlefield. Olberic is stoic, but shows a softer side from time to time. He always keeps his calm, no matter how dire the situation. Olberic is a man of few words, even when interacting with his fellow travelers. He does, however, bestow his knowledge when needed and has a strong sense of protection of them, ready to lend his strength to help. Tressa describes Olberic as 'steadfast and calm', while Primrose admires his sense of justice and thrives for self-improvement because of him. Because of his former title as a knight of Hornburg, some of his companions often address him respectfully, such as Tressa and Ophilia calling him 'Sir Olberic', while Alfyn calls him 'your lordship'.
travelers.quote: To what end do I swing my blade?

travelers.name: Cyrus Albright
travelers.bio: As a scholar, Cyrus puts knowledge before everything else. He believes that knowledge is something that must be shared with other people, in contrast with the belief of Headmaster Yvon that knowledge is an extension of one's personal power and should be obtained only for oneself. Though it is blatant that Cyrus opposes his beliefs, he keeps quiet only because saying anything might cost him his job as a scholar. He is always eloquent and respectful towards others, happy to share his knowledge whenever possible. Cyrus, with his overflowing knowledge, has excellent deduction skills. He is also rather pragmatic, taking advantage of the sabbatical to search for the missing tome, From the Far Reaches of Hell. Though, despite his intelligence, he is rather oblivious to the feelings of women who fall for him. He even mistakes the actions of envy made by his enamored student, Therese, as feelings of isolation and lack of attentiveness from her tutor. Cyrus even goes so far as to say it is his fault for not providing enough time for Therese in terms of her studying, proving that he cares for the wellbeing of his students. Ironically, Cyrus is anything but oblivious to the feelings of women for other men, which unnerves Primrose when she meets Simeon for the first time in ten years and Cyrus is quick to notice the way she looks at him. Cyrus often provides academic knowledge when talking with his fellow travelers, with mixed results. While Ophilia and Alfyn rejoice on his vast wisdom, others, such as Therion and Tressa, find it boring. Nevertheless, Cyrus always shows concern to his companions' problems, and tries to give advice whenever possible to ease their minds. His analytical mind and thirst for knowledge also has him showing interest for the other travelers' own wisdom as well.

travelers.name: Tressa Colzione
travelers.bio: Tressa is a cheerful, curious, and savvy girl who seeks adventure and discovering all sorts of things on her journey. She seems to be the type to trust people right away, as seen when she uses an unknown person's journal to lead her in her adventure. Despite this, however, she is a force to be reckoned with and will do anything in her pursuit of items and to continue on her journey. She seems to despise thievery and wants nothing more but to put a halt to such acts. As a result, she does not get along with Therion during their Travel Banter, but the two agree to disagree. Tressa is said to be a natural haggler and a born merchant, due to her talents of talking down prices and seeing the worth in items she has never seen before. This goes noticed by the merchant and former pirate captain Leon Bastralle. Her natural talent for being a merchant, as well as her tenacity in doing the right thing, give Leon enough reason for him to let Tressa board his vessel. She also appears to be willing to take the risk of venturing out alone to gain experience of being a merchant, for both her travels and for her to discover the best bargains on the continent. Tressa is very caring about her companions and often seeks guidance on their life experiences, but will also make clever remarks using her knowledge as a merchant.
travelers.quote: From the next chapter on, this will be my story.

travelers.name: Ophilia Clement
travelers.bio: Ophilia is a soft-spoken young woman with a kind heart who was raised by Archbishop Josef himself. She does what she deems is the right thing and helps those in need whenever necessary. However, she also has a strong resolve, willing to take on the church's holy pilgrimage, despite the possible repercussions, so that Lianna may remain by her ailing father's side. Josef compares her kindness to the Sacred Flame that illuminates the paths of everyone. He does hope that Ophilia's own kindness will not be her downfall and that she will never become a martyr. Initially, upon being brought into the church, Ophilia was depressed and incredibly withdrawn after losing all of her family due to a war. Lianna, however, was able to help her open up, allowing her to become the woman that she is today. Ophilia has a healthy relationship with her fellow travelers, often giving and seeking guidance from them. However, it is often pointed out that she is too kind for her own good. Therion says that Ophilia trusts others too easily, which can result in her being deceived.
travelers.quote: Till we meet again, dear sister. May the Sacred Flame light your path!

travelers.name: Primrose Azelhart
travelers.bio: With the death of her father, the loss of her home, and the persistent disgrace Helgenish brought upon her while she worked at Sunshade, Primrose was forced to mature quickly. She takes it upon herself to enact revenge on the people who took her father's life. The only thing on her mind is vengeance and she is willing to endure anything just to get leads on the three men who ruined her lifefrom the jeers of the other dancers, the cat-calling of her customers, and the abuse and the dishonor Helgenish gives her on a daily basis. Yusufa had described Primrose as a woman of few words, one who never discloses anything about herself. She acts aloof and distant from other people by locking up her true desires and feelings, for the sake of keeping up the act that pleased her previous master. However, Yusufa finds her likable either way. Primrose is also mentioned to be courageous and righteous, always standing up for Yusufa when no one else did. She was even bold enough to anger Helgenish by nearly escaping the tavern in pursuit of the man who bore the mark of the crow on his left arm. Primrose is also noted to be a good actor. She would constantly put up the faade of an ignorant and obedient woman when, in truth, she despised every moment she spent under the watchful eye of her employer. She has very good control over her emotions, rarely raising her voice even when she's feeling intense rage, although her emotional control still has its limits, such as when Helgenish kills Yusufa, her only friend during her days working for him. As Yusufa is dying, she tells Primrose that until then, she had never heard her (Primrose) shout. Above all else, Primrose is cunning and ruthless for the sake of searching for the men who killed her father, but still has a kind enough heart to put the well-being of others before her own and to not willingly endanger innocent lives for the sake of her revenge. Behind her aloof, seductive demeanour, Primrose is a very sad and lonely woman. The murder of her loving father left her with an empty feeling in her heart and she notes to herself that the pain of the abuse she endures while working for Helgenish is nothing compared to the pain of losing him. It is heavily implied that she suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder, as she has frequent nightmares about the night her father was murdered years after the incident and even goes so far as to sayseveral timesthat enacting revenge on the three men who ruined her life is the only reason she has for living. Simeon, the man marked by the crow on his neck, eventually deduces (accurately) that Primrose's quest for vengeance against him and his two associates for killing her father is really desperation to find peace from the loss she feels and the loneliness that comes with it. Simeon's chilling question as to whether Primrose felt any contentment when she killed his associates temporarily breaks her, as she realizes that Simeon is right and avenging her father's death will do nothing to ease her suffering. On the other hand, the suffering Primrose has endured in her life allows her to be more empathetic to the plights of others, as she is very kind and gentle to those who aren't targets of her anger, despite being slow to socialize. She shows a more relaxed and playful side during much of her Travel Banter with the party, flirting with them in jest. As such, she seems to open up much more easily around those she considers friends. Over the course of her journey with the other travelers, she comes to the realization that she is not alone anymore and that having companions gives her strength and courage.

travelers.name: Alfyn Greengrass
travelers.bio: Alfyn is a kind and genuine young man who is always willing to help those in need, expecting nothing in return. He has a strong sense of duty with his profession, believing that every life is worth saving, no matter their social job or status. Alfyn cares about his friends and fellow townsfolk and wants to help them in any way possible. This is shown when he shows reluctance starting an adventure to help cure the ill all over the realm and help the needy as he is worried of what will happen if he were to leave the village of Clearbrook. It is revealed by his childhood friend and fellow apothecary, Zeph, that he had been quite the troublemaker in his younger years. However, this changed when he was struck with an illness and was healed by a strange man who did not ask for anything in return for his service and only did it because he saw a person in need. Alfyn soon adopts this policy once he got better and pursued the profession of being an apothecary. Alfyn has a healthy relationship with his fellow travelers, always trying to cheer them up, being the high-spirited individual that he is. While his ideals occasionally clash with Therion's, he is nevertheless respectful and will always try to lighten the mood. His traveling companions will often comment and praise his altruistic nature, as well as his skills as a healer. However, after the criminal Miguel takes advantage of Alfyn's kind personality for his own benefit, betraying his trust after promising to reform and then wounding and nearly killing an innocent child he had captured and was holding for ransom because he was annoyed by his crying, Alfyn enters a personal crisis of faith in his duty as an apothecary. He starts to question his own beliefs that every life is worth saving and wonders if the cynical Ogen is right that wounded criminals should be left to die, especially when Ogen tells him that he went through a similar experience in his younger years when he treated a wounded criminal who then went on to murder his wife, Melyssa. However, Alfyn eventually finds a letter written to him by Zeph, whose words of encouragement strengthen his resolve that he's a human apothecary, not a god, and therefore has no right to decide who lives and who dies, so he should treat whomever he can in spite of the risks.

travelers.name: Therion
travelers.bio: Therion is cocky and cynical, which is made evident through his interactions with other characters. He remarks that a guard has a stronger bark than bite and refuses to settle in a partnership with two other thieves as he believes them to be unnecessary. Therion is quite sarcastic as well and has a dry sense of humor. Although he is a talented thief and has a sharp wit to boot, Therion is still likely to fail in his endeavors due to how short-sighted he can be, as mentioned by Heathcote. He seems to acknowledge his own faults, however, as he immediately says how he 'should have seen this coming' after falling into the trap of the Ravus Manor. Therion is also known for being a lone wolf, working better by himself and always rejecting potential offers to work with other people. It is later revealed that he has trust issues, born from being cruelly betrayed at a younger age. Later on in the game, after meeting Darius again, he is called a 'sentimental fool' due to how he has learned to put trust in people again, showing his character growth after meeting Cordelia and the other travelers.
travelers.quote: Like a thief in the night.

travelers.name: Haanit
travelers.bio: H'aanit is a cool-headed hunter who dedicates herself to helping her clan after her master left to hunt the beast Redeye. She has a strong moral compass and is a fierce hunter. H'aanit is seen to barely lose her cool despite facing dangerous situations, proving the experience she has accumulated. H'aanit is also rather mature and pragmatica foil to that of her master, who is only serious about hunting and takes life in stride. She tends to remain oblivious towards evidence of affection, as evidenced in her interactions with Alaic. Despite appearing to be a level-headed individual, H'aanit tends to also fall into a scolding spree, especially towards her master, a gambling addict. She also dislikes the idea of killing for pleasure or for sport, thinking that it disturbs the natural order of the forest and must be quenched at once. She is a firm believer of the ideals taught by Z'aanta, her mentor. Additionally, H'aanit believes that all living beings should be respected and, in a conversation with Primrose, was infuriated that Simeon would create a play to mock Primrose's life. However, she is shown to be flexible when it comes to misdemeanors, particularly those committed by allies, as shown in a conversation with Therion, where she says she can put aside her prejudices for comrades.
travelers.quote: Lives entwined, a tapestry woven anew each dawn, every thread a part of the whole.

travelers.name: Ochette
travelers.bio: She is a cute, cheerful, eager, energetic beastling with a huge appetite to the point where she finishes any non-food related tasks quickly as she can, so she can eat as soon as possible. But despite her appetite, she is a kind, empathetic and generous beastling, to the point she is willing to share her spoils to those who need it more than her. Other than that, she has no darkness in her heart at all, making it impossible for the Shadow to corrupt, this is because the creation of the Beastlings made it impossible to feel malice or greed.
travelers.quote: Leave the hunting to me. You'll have all the tasty meat you want! Heh heh! I'm already looking forward to snacking together!

travelers.name: Castti Florenz
travelers.bio: She had amnesia with no memories, or clues of her past, other than what was in her bag. But despite her memory loss she is still kind and gentle as she was in the past, however, she has quite a temper to those who stop her from helping those in need, be they familiar or otherwise. She's shown to be very skilled, likely due to years of experience, and it is later revealed she was the chief of her group of apothecaries before whatever event took her memories; this aligns with how she naturally steps into a leadership role when it comes to medicine, seen in her Chapter 2, as she does not hesitate to issue orders. Her lack of memories seems to trouble her, however, and weigh down her otherwise patient and kind temperament, and many of the flashes of memories she manages to recover only concern her more. She also struggles with why her memories were removed in the first place, and it's revealed in another talk with Hikari that she partially fears what she may uncover, in case her own mind buried the memories after some horrible trauma. Castti is also quite maternal and caring, with her fellow apothecaries and Ochette nicknaming her 'Mother Hen' and 'Ma' respectively. Her tendency to take charge for her peers' well-being and aid those around her makes her well-liked among most who meet her. Despite her maturity, she does occasionally act in a mischievous manner. Travel banter with Agnea and Hikari shows that she gets quite unruly while drunk, and when Partitio says that he doesn't understand what amnesia feels like, she responds by tricking him into thinking that he and her 'got up to all sorts of mischief' while drunk the night before.
travelers.quote: Any ache, pain or ill, I'll patch you right up. I'm sure you won't regret having me around. You choose the road for now, and I'll follow.

travelers.name: Thron Anguis
travelers.bio: Thron shares several personality traits with Primrose from the first game. She is calm, composed, and goal-oriented, motivated by the desire for freedom. Both also share a traumatic upbringing with varying types of physical and psychological abuse that has shaped their adult personalities. They also share a sort of ruthlessness in pursuit of their ultimate goal, willing to do anything including placing themselves in physical or emotional danger if it will get them closer. Despite Thron's upbringing and profession, she dislikes unnecessary bloodshed, with a prominent recurring motif being that she hates the smell, and has since she was a young child; this contrasts with Father's attitude he tries to instill. She's also shown to be kind and merciful, such as empathizing with a small stray dog in New Delsta and convincing her compatriot, Scaracci, not to kill a guard Thron rendered unconscious during her first chapter. In addition, she intends to not only secure her own freedom from a job she hates, but to end the Blacksnakes entirely, and the cycle of taking in and grooming orphaned children into becoming Blacksnakes themselves. Her empathy also leads her to feel an emotional connection with those she recognizes as being in a similar spot, such as Osvald, and those who have a similar desire to end the cycle of violence they find themselves in, such as Hikari.

travelers.name: Osvald V. Vanstein
travelers.bio: He is an aloof and misunderstood but smart man who wants revenge for everything Harvey did to him, stealing his research, burning his home down, killing his family, framing him for the murder, for that he had pretty much every right to get revenge on him. But despite his persistent desire, he does have a warm heart, as he thanked a man for helping him, and over the course of his journey, particularly when he found out his daughter wasn't dead but brainwashed by Harvey, he learned to fight to protect those he cared for.
travelers.quote: So, what are you waiting for? Let's go.

travelers.name: Partitio Yellowil
travelers.bio: He is a charismatic, hardworking but kind man, who has all the makings of a good Merchant, who wants to get rid of poverty once and for all. But despite his kindness, should anyone 'get his goat' he will lose his temper at times, but he is still kind no less. He is quite forgiving, willing to offer hiring positions to the likes of Thurston even after their dirty actions.
travelers.quote: I'm lookin' forward to sharing a campfire with you!

travelers.name: Agnea Bristarni
travelers.bio: Because of her pleasant childhood, she is a cheerful and optimistic woman who has big dreams of becoming a star just like her mother. Despite this, she knows what's right as she is a compassionate woman to all those in need of help or hope, as she looked up to her mother for her kindness, and she wanted to bring smiles to others faces just as she did. She is also quite clumsy, tripping over herself on multiple occasions.
travelers.quote: I'm a great dancer! You won't regret this!

travelers.name: Temenos Mistral
travelers.bio: He is an easy-going albeit lackadaisical cleric, though he is also incredibly intelligent and kindhearted, yet relentless. He also appears to have distrust toward authority figures, except for the Pontiff, as shown with his constant squabbling with the Sanctum Knights. He can be snarky and have a witty remark about everything, and he loves teasing people, Crick especially. But despite this, he has shown to care for Crick as he does for Temenos, and when he died, he skipped the snarky attitude and vowed he would bring the murderer to justice.
travelers.quote: The Sacred Flame shall light our path... Probably.

travelers.name: Hikaru Ku
travelers.bio: While Clan Ku is known for their ambition and ferocity, Hikari represents none of those things. He is a kindhearted, and honorable prince who believes that their kingdom needs allies, community and peace for one and all rather than enemies and war, unlike his brother, which makes his father want to give him the crown and not Mugen. But despite his kindness, he does have inner demons in him that are sadistic and against every thing Hikari stands for, only because of the blood of clan Ku.
travelers.quote: Good, good. It's seems my sword won't be left to rust after all.
